metadata.title: CVE-2018-1999023 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The Battle for Wesnoth Project version 1.7.0 through 1.14.3 contains a CodeInjection vulnerability in the Lua scripting engine that can result in codeexecution outside the sandbox. This attack appear to be exploitable viaLoading specially-crafted saved games, networked games, replays, and playercontent.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1999023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wesnoth - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14 - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-aoi - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-core - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-data - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-did - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-dm - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-dw - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-ei - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-httt - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-l - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-low - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-music - 1:1.14.4-1

wesnoth-1.14-tools - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-trow - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-tsg - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-ttb - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-1.14-utbs - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-core - 1:1.14.4-1
wesnoth-music - 1:1.14.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wesnoth-1.14 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.14.4-1').
